content: 1 1 1 1 1 25 1 25 1 25 1 25 1 25 1 25 1 5 1 5 1 5 1 5 switch to larger needles and proceed to neckline increase round sleeve sts on hold ribbing last method an alternative method is to pick up and knit a ribbed neckline after completing the remainder of body the sweater this creates more structure from which the sweater can hang this is most useful for larger sizes and heavier yarn weights working the ribbing last also makes it easier to adjust the neckline stitch count gauge and bind-off gauge for a perfect fit after casting on switch to larger needles knit a single round then proceed to neckline increase round neckline increase round knit increasing 12 14 12 20 22 24 26 24 26 28 30 34 34 36 36 44 52 64 76 sts evenly spaced 68 76 80 88 92 96 104 104 108 116 120 124 124 128 132 140 148 160 172 sts flax sweater worsted/aran facebook-square instagram ravelry pinterest envelope www tincanknits com 4 of knitting direction markers back sleeve sleeve ribbed collar collar front back front eveels thgir tfel eveels yoke garter panel increase lines at raglan markers separation of sleeves and sleeve sts body on hold sts cast on body sts at underarms on needle sleeves garter panel d o ir f e k c n ti i o tt n in g yoke round 5 knit to raglan marker sm kfb knit to 2 sts before raglan marker kfb k1 sm twice 4 sts marker set-up k2 p8 8 8 10 10 10 12 12 12 increase -
